Technique: PAINTED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Hypocephalus
Description: This hypocephalos (see also E.6319) dates to the Ptolemaic Period and is characterised by a black-painted upper surface. The texts are taken from Spell 162 of the Book of the Dead and are written in yellow. The piece belonged to a certain Rekh-gem, a rather uncommon name.
